snippet: Distressing new federal data on the disciplinary treatment of black students adds urgency to investigations into the treatment of minority children.
abstract: Editorial expresses alarm concerning new federal data on the disciplinary treatment of black students, who are three-and-a-half times more likely to be suspended or expelled than their white peers; urges schools to reconsider overly broad 'zero tolerance' policies that can lead to vicious cycles for many students; encourages the Office of Civil Rights to press school systems with the worst records to develop fairer policies.
lead_paragraph: Distressing new federal data on the disciplinary treatment of black students adds urgency to investigations into the treatment of minority children.
